message.content:
cs.CR, cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.LG, cs.GT 

The paper discusses the security and incentive mechanisms of Proof-of-Stake protocols in cryptocurrencies, which falls under the category of computer security (cs.CR). The paper also involves the analysis of distributed systems (cs.DC) and graph theory (cs.DS) in the context of blockchain protocols. Additionally, the paper uses game theory (cs.GT) to analyze the incentives of participants in the protocol. Finally, the paper involves mathematical modeling and analysis (cs.LG) to derive formal barriers to designing incentive-compatible Proof-of-Stake cryptocurrencies.
